radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver shows no evidence of focal lesions or textural abnormality. There is new mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation as well as increased extrahepatic biliary dilatation with the common bile duct measuring 7 mm. The gallbladder is normal without evidence of stones or gallbladder wall thickening. Limited views of the pancreatic head and body are unremarkable although evaluation of the tail is limited by overlying bowel gas. Doppler assessment of the main portal vein demonstrates patency and hepatopetal flow.
